019package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static java.util.Arrays.deepToString;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NULL_STRING;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.internal.SharedFormatter.format;
026
027import java.lang.reflect.Array;
028import java.util.Arrays;
029import java.util.Collection;
030import java.util.Collections;
031import java.util.Comparator;
032import java.util.Enumeration;
033import java.util.List;
034import java.util.Map;
035import java.util.Optional;
036import java.util.function.Function;
037import java.util.function.Predicate;
038import java.util.function.Supplier;
039import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;

041import org.apiguardian.api.API;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
043import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
044import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.BlankArgumentException;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.EmptyArgumentException;
046import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException;
047import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
048import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;

050/**
051 *  <p>{@summary This class consists of several utility methods working on
052 *  {@link Object}
053 *  instances, similar to those on
054 *  {@link Arrays}
055 *  or
056 *  {@link Collections}.}</p>
057 *  <p>The class was originally inspired by the class of the same name that
058 *  was finally introduced with the Java&nbsp;7 release; some of its methods
059 *  will delegate to
060 *  {@link java.util.Objects java.util.Objects},
061 *  others will extend the functionality of the methods with the same
062 *  name from {@code java.util.Objects}.</p>
063 *  <p>If a method from {@code java.util.Objects} would throw a
064 *  {@link NullPointerException},
065 *  the method with the same name from this class would throw a
066 *  {@link ValidationException}
067 *  instead.</p>
068 *
069 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
070 *  @version $Id: Objects.java 1032 2022-04-10 17:27:44Z tquadrat $
071 *  @since 0.1.0
072 *
073 *  @UMLGraph.link
074 */
075@UtilityClass
076@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "UseOfObsoleteDateTimeApi", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
077@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Objects.java 1032 2022-04-10 17:27:44Z tquadrat $" )
078public final class Objects
079{
080        /*--------------*\
081    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
082        \*--------------*/
083    /**
084     *  No instance allowed for this class.
085     */
086    private Objects() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Objects.class ); }
087
088        /*---------*\
089    ====** Methods **==========================================================
090        \*---------*/
091    /**
092     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
093     *  to {@code fromIndex + size} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range
094     *  from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
095     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
096     *  inequalities is true:</p>
097     *  <ul>
098     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
099     *    <li>{@code size < 0}</li>
100     *    <li>{@code fromIndex + size > length}, taking into account integer
101     *    overflow</li>
102     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
103     *    inequalities</li>
104     *  </ul>
105     *  <p>Calls
106     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int)}
107     *  internally.</p>
108     *
109     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-interval.
110     *  @param  size    The size of the sub-range.
111     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
112     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
113     *      range.
114     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
115     */
116    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
117    public static final int checkFromIndexSize( final int fromIndex, final int size, final int length )
118    {
119        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize( fromIndex, size, length );
120
121        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
122        return retValue;
123    }   //  checkFromIndexSize()
124
125    /**
126     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
127     *  to {@code toIndex} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range from
128     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
129     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
130     *  inequalities is true:</p>
131     *  <ul>
132     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
133     *    <li>{@code fromIndex > toIndex}</li>
134     *    <li>{@code toIndex > length}</li>
135     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
136     *    inequalities</li>
137     *  </ul>
138     *  <p>Calls
139     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromToIndex(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex(int,int,int)}
140     *  internally.</p>
141     *
142     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-range.
143     *  @param  toIndex The upper-bound (exclusive) of the sub-range.
144     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) the range.
145     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
146     *      range.
147     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
148     */
149    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
150    public static final int checkFromToIndex( final int fromIndex, final int toIndex, final int length )
151    {
152        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex( fromIndex, toIndex, length );
153
154        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
155        return retValue;
156    }   //  checkFromToIndex()
157
158    /**
159     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the {@code index} is within the bounds of the
160     *  range from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
161     *  <p>The {@code index} is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
162     *  following inequalities is true:</p>
163     *  <ul>
164     *    <li>{@code index < 0}</li>
165     *    <li>{@code index >= length}</li>
166     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
167     *    inequalities</li>
168     *  </ul>
169     *  <p>Calls
170     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkIndex(int,int) java.util.Objects.checkIndex(int,int)}
171     *  internally.</p>
172     *
173     *  @param  index   The index.
174     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
175     *  @return The {@code index} if it is within bounds of the range.
176     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The {@code index} is out-of-bounds.
177     */
178    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
179    public static final int checkIndex( final int index, final int length )
180    {
181        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkIndex( index, length );
182
183        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
184        return retValue;
185    }   //  checkIndex()
186
187    /**
188     *  <p>{@summary Throws the exception provided by the given supplier if the
189     *  condition resolves to {@code false}.}</p>
190     *  <p>Basically, this method is a replacement for the code sequence
191     *  below:</p>
192     *  <pre><code>  â¦
193     *  if( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt; )
194     *  {
195     *      throw new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; );
196     *  }
197     *  â¦</code></pre>
198     *  <p>that may be easier to read than the {@code if} statement:</p>
199     *  <pre><code>  â¦
200     *  checkState( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt;, () -> new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; ) );
201     *  â¦</code></pre>
202     *
203     *  @param  <E> The type of the exception that is thrown in case the
204     *      condition is not met.
205     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
206     *  @param  exception   The exception to throw.
207     *  @throws E   The condition was not met.
208     */
209    @SuppressWarnings( "CheckedExceptionClass" )
210    public static final <E extends Exception> void checkState( final boolean condition, final Supplier<E> exception ) throws E
211    {
212        if( !condition ) throw requireNonNullArgument( exception, "exception" ).get();
213    }   //  checkState()
214
215    /**
216     *  <p>{@summary Returns 0 if the arguments are identical and
217     *  {@code comparator.compare(a, b)} otherwise.}</p>
218     *  <p>Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, 0 is returned.</p>
219     *  <p>Calls
220     *  {@link java.util.Objects#compare(Object,Object,Comparator) java.util.Objects#compare()}
221     *  internally, but different from that method, this implementation will
222     *  throw a
223     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
224     *  in case the {@code comparator} is {@code null}.</p>
225     *
226     *  @param  <T> The type of the objects being compared.
227     *  @param  a   An object.
228     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a}.
229     *  @param  comparator  The
230     *      {@link Comparator}
231     *      to compare the first two arguments.
232     *  @return 0 if the arguments are identical and +1, 0, or -1, based on the
233     *      return value of {@code c.compare(a, b)} otherwise.
234     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code comparator} is {@code null}.
235     *
236     *  @see Comparable
237     *  @see Comparator
238     */
239    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
240    public static final <T> int compare( final T a, final T b, final Comparator<? super T> comparator ) throws NullArgumentException
241    {
242        final var retValue = a == b ? 0 : signum( java.util.Objects.compare( a, b, requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" ) ) );
243
244        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
245        return retValue;
246    }   //  compare()
247
248    /**
249     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to
250     *  each other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
251     *  <p>Two {@code null} values are deeply equal. If both arguments are
252     *  arrays, the algorithm in
253     *  {@link Arrays#deepEquals(Object[], Object[]) Arrays.deepEquals()}
254     *  is used to determine equality. Otherwise, equality is determined by
255     *  using the
256     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
257     *  method of the first argument.</p>
258     *  <p>Calls
259     *  {@link java.util.Objects#deepEquals(Object,Object) java.util.Objects#deepEquals()}
260     *  internally.</p>
261     *
262     *  @param  a   An object.
263     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for deep equality.
264     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to each other
265     *      and {@code false} otherwise.
266     *
267     *  @see    Arrays#deepEquals(Object[],Object[])
268     *  @see    Objects#equals(Object,Object)
269     */
270    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
271    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
272    public static final boolean deepEquals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.deepEquals( a, b ); }
273
274    /**
275     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each
276     *  other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
277     *  <p> Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is
278     *  returned and if exactly one argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is
279     *  returned.  Otherwise, equality is determined by using the
280     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
281     *  method of the first argument.</p>
282     *  <p>Calls
283     *  {@link java.util.Objects#equals(Object, Object)}
284     *  internally.</p>
285     *
286     *  @param  a   An object.
287     *  @param  b   An object to be compared with {@code a} for equality.
288     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each other and
289     *      {@code false} otherwise.
290     *
291     *  @see    Object#equals(Object)
292     */
293    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
294    public static final boolean equals( final Object a, final Object b ) { return java.util.Objects.equals( a, b ); }
295
296    /**
297     *  <p>{@summary Generates a hash code for a sequence of input values.} The
298     *  hash code is generated as if all the input values were placed into an
299     *  array, and that array is hashed by calling
300     *  {@link Arrays#hashCode(Object[])}.</p>
301     *  <p>Calls
302     *  {@link java.util.Arrays#hashCode(Object[]) java.util.Arrays.hashCode()}
303     *  internally.</p>
304     *
305     *  @param  values  The values to be hashed.
306     *  @return A hash value of the sequence of input values.
307     *
308     *  @see    List#hashCode
309     */
310    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
311    public static final int hash( final Object... values ) { return Arrays.hashCode( values ); }
312
313    /**
314     *  <p>{@summary Returns the hash code of a non-{@code null} argument and 0
315     *  for a {@code null} argument.}</p>
316     *  <p>Calls
317     *  {@link java.util.Objects#hashCode(Object) java.util.Objects.hashCode(Object)}
318     *  internally.</p>
319     *
320     *  @param o   An object.
321     *  @return The hash code of an argument that is not {@code null}, and 0
322     *      for a {@code null} argument,
323     *
324     *  @see    Object#hashCode
325     */
326    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
327    public static final int hashCode( final Object o ) { return java.util.Objects.hashCode( o ); }
328
329    /**
330     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is
331     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
332     *  <p>This method can be used as a
333     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
334     *  {@code filter(Objects::isNull)}.</p>
335     *  <p>Calls
336     *  {@link java.util.Objects#isNull(Object) java.util.Objects.isNull()}
337     *  internally.</p>
338     *
339     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}.
340     *  @return {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null},
341     *      otherwise {@code false}
342     *
343     *  @see    java.util.function.Predicate
344     *  @see    org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#IS_NULL
345     */
346    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
347    public static final boolean isNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.isNull( obj ); }
348
349    /**
350     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
351     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null}.}</p>
352     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance
353     *  is {@code null}.</p>
354     *
355     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
356     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
357     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
358     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
359     *  @return The result of the mapping, or {@code null} if the given object
360     *      instance was already {@code null}. Keep in mind that the result of
361     *      the mapping can be {@code null}!
362     */
363    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,? extends R> mapper )
364    {
365        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
366        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : null;
367
368        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
369        return retValue;
370    }   //  mapNonNull()
371
372    /**
373     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
374     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null} or returns the
375     *  given default value.}</p>
376     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance
377     *  is {@code null}.</p>
378     *
379     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
380     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
381     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
382     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
383     *  @param  defaultValue    The default value; can be {@code null}.
384     *  @return The result of the mapping, or the default value if the given
385     *      object instance is {@code null}. Keep in mind that the result of
386     *      the mapping can be {@code null}!
387     */
388    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,? extends R> mapper, final R defaultValue )
389    {
390        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
391        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : defaultValue;
392
393        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
394        return retValue;
395    }   //  mapNonNull()
396
397    /**
398     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is not
399     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
400     *  <p>This method exists to be used as a
401     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
402     *  {@code filter(Objects::nonNull)}</p>
403     *  <p>Calls
404     *  {@link java.util.Objects#nonNull(Object) java.util.Objects.nonNull()}
405     *  internally.</p>
406     *
407     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}
408     *  @return {@code false} if the provided reference is {@code null},
409     *      otherwise {@code true}
410     *
411     *  @see java.util.function.Predicate
412     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NON_NULL
413     */
414    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
415    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
416    public static final boolean nonNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.nonNull( obj ); }
417
418    /**
419     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
420     *  {@link ValidationException}
421     *  is thrown.
422     *
423     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
424     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
425     *  @param  validation  The validation
426     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
427     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
428     *
429     *  @since 0.1.0
430     */
431    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
432    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
433    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
434    {
435        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
436        {
437            throw new ValidationException();
438        }
439
440        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
441        return obj;
442    }   //  require()
443
444    /**
445     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
446     *  {@link ValidationException}
447     *  with the specified message is thrown.
448     *
449     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
450     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
451     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
452     *  @param  validation  The validation
453     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
454     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
455     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
456     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
457     *
458     *  @since 0.1.0
459     */
460    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
461    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final String message, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
462    {
463        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
464
465        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
466        {
467            throw new ValidationException( message );
468        }
469
470        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
471        return obj;
472    }   //  require()
473
474    /**
475     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
476     *  that fails, a customized
477     *  {@link ValidationException}
478     *  is thrown.}</p>
479     *  <p>Unlike the method
480     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
481     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
482     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
483     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care should be taken
484     *  that the costs for the creation of the message supplier are less than
485     *  the cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
486     *
487     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
488     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
489     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
490     *      in the event that an {@code ValidationException} is thrown. If
491     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
492     *      provided to the exception.
493     *  @param  validation  The validation
494     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
495     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The validation is {@code null}.
496     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obk} failed the validation.
497     *
498     *  @since 0.1.0
499     */
500    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
501    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
502    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
503    {
504        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
505        {
506            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
507                ? new ValidationException( messageSupplier.get() )
508                : new ValidationException();
509            throw exception;
510        }
511
512        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
513        return obj;
514    }   //  require()
515
516    /**
517     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
518     *  that fails, a customized
519     *  {@link ValidationException}
520     *  is thrown.}</p>
521     *  <p>Unlike the method
522     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
523     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
524     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
525     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care  should be taken
526     *  that the costs the creation of the message supplier are less than the
527     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
528     *  <p>This implementation is different from
529     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
530     *  as it takes an instance of
531     *  {@link Function}
532     *  for the {@code messageSupplier}. That function is called with
533     *  {@code obj} as the argument; this allows to add the invalid value to
534     *  the exception detail message. The provided message supplier function
535     *  must accept {@code null} as a valid argument.</p>
536     *
537     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
538     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
539     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
540     *      in the event that an {@code ValidationException} is thrown. If
541     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
542     *      provided.
543     *  @param  validation  The validation
544     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
545     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The validation is {@code null}.
546     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
547     *
548     *  @since 0.1.0
549     */
550    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
551    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
552    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Function<? super T,String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
553    {
554        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
555        {
556            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
557                ? new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( obj ) )
558                : new NullArgumentException();
559            throw exception;
560        }
561
562        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
563        return obj;
564    }   //  require()
565
566    /**
567     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code obj} is {@code null} and
568     *  throws a
569     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
570     *  if it is {@code null}.}</p>
571     *
572     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
573     *  @param  obj The value to check.
574     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
575     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code obj} is {@code null}.
576     *
577     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object)
578     */
579    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
580    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
581    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj ) throws NullArgumentException
582    {
583        if( isNull( obj ) ) throw new NullArgumentException();
584
585        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
586        return obj;
587    }   //  requireNonNull()
588
589    /**
590     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code obj} is {@code null} and
591     *  throws a
592     *  {@link ValidationException}
593     *  with the specified message if it is {@code null}.}</p>
594     *
595     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
596     *  @param  obj The value to check.
597     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
598     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
599     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
600     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code obj} is {@code null}.
601     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
602     *
603     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object,String)
604     */
605    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
606    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj, final String message ) throws ValidationException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
607    {
608        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
609        if( isNull( obj ) ) throw new ValidationException( message );
610
611        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
612        return obj;
613    }   //  requireNonNull()
614
615    /**
616     *  <p>{@summary Checks that the specified object reference is not
617     *  {@code null} and throws a customized
618     *  {@link ValidationException}
619     *  if it is.}</p>
620     *  <p>Unlike the method
621     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object,String)},
622     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
623     *  null check failed. While this may confer a performance advantage in the
624     *  non-{@code null} case, when deciding to call this method care should be
625     *  taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are less than the
626     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
627     *
628     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
629     *  @param  obj The value to check.
630     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
631     *      in the event that a {@code NullArgumentException} is thrown. If
632     *      {@code null}, no detail message is provided.
633     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
634     *  @throws ValidationException    {@code obj} is {@code null}
635     */
636    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
637    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier) throws ValidationException
638    {
639        if( isNull( obj ) )
640        {
641            final var message = nonNull( messageSupplier ) ? messageSupplier.get() : null;
642            @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
643            final var exception = isNull( message ) ? new NullArgumentException() : new ValidationException( message );
644            throw exception;
645        }
646
647        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
648        return obj;
649    }   //  requireNonNull()
650
651    /**
652     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
653     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
654     *  if it is {@code null}.
655     *
656     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
657     *  @param  arg The argument to check.
658     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
659     *      message.
660     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
661     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
662     */
663    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
664    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name )
665    {
666        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
667        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
668        if( isNull( arg ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
669
670        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
671        return arg;
672    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
673
674    /**
675     *  <p>{@summary Checks if not both of the given arguments {@code arg} and
676     *  {@code otherArg} are {@code null} and throws a
677     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
678     *  if both are {@code null}.} Otherwise, it returns {@code arg}.</p>
679     *
680     *  @param  <T> The type of the first argument to check.
681     *  @param  arg The first argument to check; it will be returned in case of
682     *      success, even if {@code null}.
683     *  @param  otherArg    The other argument to check.
684     *  @param  name    The name of the first argument; this is used for the
685     *      error message.
686     *  @param  otherName   The name of the other argument; this is used for
687     *      the error message.
688     *  @return The first argument, even that might be {@code null}.
689     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Both arguments are {@code null}.
690     */
691    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
692    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final Object otherArg, final String name, final String otherName )
693    {
694        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
695        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
696        if( isNull( otherName ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "otherName" );
697        if( otherName.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "otherName" );
698        if( isNull( arg ) && isNull( otherArg ) )
699        {
700            throw new NullArgumentException( name, otherName );
701        }
702
703        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
704        return arg;
705    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
706
707    /**
708     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given String argument {@code arg} is
709     *  {@code null}, empty or blank and throws a
710     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
711     *  if it is {@code null}, an
712     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
713     *  if it is empty, or a
714     *  {@link BlankArgumentException}
715     *  if it is blank.}</p>
716     *
717     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
718     *  @param  arg The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
719     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
720     *      message.
721     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}, empty or blank.
722     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
723     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code arg} is empty.
724     *  @throws BlankArgumentException   {@code arg} is blank.
725     *
726     *  @see    String#isBlank()
727     */
728    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
729    public static final <T extends CharSequence> T requireNotBlankArgument( final T arg, final String name )
730    {
731        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
732        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
733
734        switch( arg )
735        {
736            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
737            //noinspection QuestionableName
738            case String string ->
739            {
740                if( string.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
741                if( string.isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
742            }
743            case CharSequence charSequence ->
744            {
745                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
746                if( charSequence.toString().isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
747            }
748        }
749
750        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
751        return arg;
752    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
753
754    /**
755     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code arg} is {@code null} or
756     *  empty and throws a
757     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
758     *  if it is {@code null}, or an
759     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
760     *  if it is empty.}</p>
761     *  <p>Strings, arrays, instances of
762     *  {@link java.util.Collection} and
763     *  {@link java.util.Map}
764     *  as well as instances of
765     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuilder},
766     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuffer},
767     *  and
768     *  {@link java.lang.CharSequence}
769     *  will be checked on being empty.</p>
770     *  <p>For an instance of
771     *  {@link java.util.Optional},
772     *  the presence of a value is checked in order to determine whether the
773     *  {@link Optional} is empty or not.</p>
774     *  <p>Because the interface
775     *  {@link java.util.Enumeration}
776     *  does not provide an API for the check on emptiness
777     *  ({@link java.util.Enumeration#hasMoreElements() hasMoreElements()}
778     *  will return {@code false} after all elements have been taken from
779     *  the {@code Enumeration} instance), the result for arguments of this
780     *  type has to be taken with caution.</p>
781     *  <p>For instances of
782     *  {@link java.util.stream.Stream},
783     *  this method will only check for {@code null} (like
784     *  {@link #requireNonNullArgument(Object,String)}.
785     *  This is because any operation on the stream itself would render it
786     *  unusable for later processing.</p>
787     *  <p>In case the argument is of type
788     *  {@link Optional},
789     *  this method behaves different from
790     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String)};
791     *  this one will return the {@code Optional} instance, while the other
792     *  method will return the contents of the {@code Optional}.</p>
793     *  <p>This method will not work properly for instances of
794     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner}, because its method
795     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner#length() length()}
796     *  will not return 0 when a prefix, suffix, or an
797     *  &quot;{@linkplain java.util.StringJoiner#setEmptyValue(CharSequence) empty value}&quot;
798     *  was provided.</p>
799     *
800     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
801     *  @param  arg The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
802     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
803     *      message.
804     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null} or empty.
805     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
806     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code arg} is empty.
807     */
808    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
809    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
810    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( final T arg, final String name )
811    {
812        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
813        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
814
815        switch( arg )
816        {
817            /*
818             * When using guarding expressions, the code would not get better
819             * to read and to understand, as the positive cases will be handled
820             * all by the default case.
821             */
822            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
823            case CharSequence charSequence ->
824            {
825                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
826            }
827            case Collection<?> collection ->
828            {
829                if( collection.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
830            }
831            case Map<?,?> map ->
832            {
833                if( map.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
834            }
835            case Enumeration<?> enumeration ->
836            {
837                /*
838                 * The funny thing with an Enumeration is that it could have
839                 * been not empty in the beginning, but it may be empty
840                 * (= having no more elements) now.
841                 * The good thing is that Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will
842                 * not change the state of the Enumeration - at least it should
843                 * not do so.
844                 */
845                if( !enumeration.hasMoreElements() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
846            }
847            case Optional<?> optional ->
848            {
849                /*
850                 * This is different from the behaviour of
851                 * requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String) as the Optional
852                 * will be returned here.
853                 */
854                if( optional.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
855            }
856            default ->
857            {
858                if( arg.getClass().isArray() )
859                {
860                    if( Array.getLength( arg ) == 0 ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
861                }
862                else
863                {
864                    /*
865                     * Other data types are not further processed; in
866                     * particular, instances of Stream cannot be checked on
867                     * being empty. This is because any operation on the Stream
868                     * itself will change its state and may make the Stream
869                     * unusable.
870                     */
871                }
872            }
873        }
874
875        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
876        return arg;
877    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
878
879    /**
880     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code optional} of type
881     *  {@link Optional}
882     *  is {@code null} or
883     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
884     *  and throws a
885     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
886     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
887     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
888     *  if it is empty.}</p>
889     *  <p>Otherwise it returns the value of the {@code Optional}.</p>
890     *  <p>This is different from the behaviour of
891     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Object,String)}
892     *  with an instance of {@code Optional} as the argument to test.</p>
893     *
894     *  @param  <T> The type of the given {@code Optional} to check.
895     *  @param  optional    The argument to check; can be {@code null}.
896     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
897     *      message.
898     *  @return The value of the argument if {@code optional} is not
899     *      {@code null}
900     *      and not
901     *      {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}. This could be the empty
902     *      string!
903     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code optional} is {@code null}.
904     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code optional} is empty.
905     */
906    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
907    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" ) final Optional<T> optional, final String name )
908    {
909        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
910        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
911
912        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
913        if( isNull( optional ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
914        final var retValue = optional.orElseThrow( () -> new EmptyArgumentException( name ) );
915
916        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
917        return retValue;
918    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
919
920    /**
921     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
922     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} second argument.}</p>
923     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
924     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object,Object) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse(Object,Object)}
925     *  as it will always check that the default is not {@code null}.</p>
926     *
927     *  @param <T>  The type of the references.
928     *  @param  obj An object reference.
929     *  @param  defaultObj  Another object reference to be returned if the
930     *      first argument is {@code null}.
931     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
932     *      second argument if it is not {@code null}.
933     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code defaultObj} is {@code null}.
934     *
935     *  @see    java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object, Object)
936     */
937    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
938    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElse( final T obj, final T defaultObj ) throws NullArgumentException
939    {
940        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse( obj, requireNonNullArgument( defaultObj, "defaultObj" ) );
941    }   //  requireNonNullElse()
942
943    /**
944     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
945     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} value returned by
946     *  {@link Supplier#get() supplier.get()}.}</p>
947     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
948     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier)}
949     *  as it will always check that the supplier is not {@code null}.</p>
950     *
951     *  @note   Although the provided {@code Supplier} may not be {@code null},
952     *      it may <i>return</i> {@code null}.
953     *
954     *  @param <T>  The type of the reference.
955     *  @param  obj An object reference.
956     *  @param  supplier    The supplier of a non-{@code null} object of type
957     *      {code T} to return if the first argument is {@code null}.
958     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
959     *      value returned by a call to {@code supplier.get()} if it is not
960     *      {@code null}.
961     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code supplier} is {@code null}.
962     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code obj} is {@code null} and the
963     *      return value of {@code supplier.get()} value is {@code null}, too.
964     */
965    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionDeclared" )
966    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
967    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElseGet( final T obj, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier ) throws NullArgumentException, NullPointerException
968    {
969        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet( obj, requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ) );
970    }   //  requireNonNullElseGet()
971
972    /**
973     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
974     *  {@link ValidationException}
975     *  with a default message is thrown.
976     *
977     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
978     *  @param  arg The value to check; can be {@code null}.
979     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
980     *      message.
981     *  @param  validation  The validation
982     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
983     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
984     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
985     *      {@code null}.
986     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
987     *
988     *  @since 0.1.0
989     */
990    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
991    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
992    {
993        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
994
995        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
996        {
997            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
998        }
999
1000        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1001        return arg;
1002    }   //  requireValidArgument()
1003
1004    /**
1005     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
1006     *  that fails, a
1007     *  {@link ValidationException}
1008     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1009     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1010     *  argument.</p>
1011     *
1012     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1013     *  @param  arg The value to check; can be {@code null}.
1014     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1015     *      message.
1016     *  @param  validation  The validation
1017     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1018     *      exception.
1019     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1020     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1021     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
1022     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1023     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1024     *
1025     *  @since 0.1.0
1026     */
1027    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1028    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1029    {
1030        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1031        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
1032
1033        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1034        {
1035            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1036        }
1037
1038        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1039        return arg;
1040    }   //  requireValidArgument()
1041
1042    /**
1043     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1044     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, an
1045     *  {@link ValidationException}
1046     *  with a default message is thrown.}</p>
1047     *  <p>If the value is {@code null}, the validation is never triggered.</p>
1048     *
1049     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1050     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1051     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1052     *      message.
1053     *  @param  validation  The validation
1054     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1055     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
1056     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg}, {@code name} or
1057     *      {@code validation} is {@code null}.
1058     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1059     *
1060     *  @since 0.1.0
1061     */
1062    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1063    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
1064    {
1065        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1066
1067        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( arg, "name" ) ) )
1068        {
1069            throw new ValidationException( format( "Validation failed for '%s'", name ) );
1070        }
1071
1072        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1073        return arg;
1074    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1075
1076    /**
1077     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1078     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, a
1079     *  {@link ValidationException}
1080     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1081     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1082     *  argument.</p>
1083     *
1084     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1085     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1086     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1087     *      message.
1088     *  @param  validation  The validation
1089     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1090     *      exception.
1091     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1092     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1093     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg}, {@code name},
1094     *      {@code validation} or {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1095     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1096     *
1097     *  @since 0.1.0
1098     */
1099    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1100    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1101    {
1102        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1103        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
1104
1105        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( arg, "name" ) ) )
1106        {
1107            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1108        }
1109
1110        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1111        return arg;
1112    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1113
1114    /**
1115     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1116     *  {@link String},
1117     *  usually by calling its
1118     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1119     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1120     *  &quot;{@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING null}&quot;
1121     *  will be returned instead. Arrays will be converted to a String through
1122     *  calling the respective {@code toString()} method from
1123     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1124     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1125     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object, String) java.util.Objects.toString()}).
1126     *  Values of type
1127     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1128     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1129     *  will be translated based on the default locale - whatever that is.
1130     *
1131     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1132     *  @return The object's string representation.
1133     *
1134     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1135     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1136     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1137     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1138     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1139     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1140     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1141     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1142     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1143     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1144     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1145     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING
1146     */
1147    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1148    public static final String toString( final Object object )
1149    {
1150        return toString( object, NULL_STRING );
1151    }   //  toString()
1152
1153    /**
1154     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1155     *  {@link String},
1156     *  usually by calling its
1157     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1158     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1159     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1160     *  instead.</p>
1161     *  <p>Arrays will be converted to a string through calling the respective
1162     *  {@code toString()} method from
1163     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1164     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1165     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object,String) java.util.Objects.toString(Object,String)}).</p>
1166     *  <p>Values of type
1167     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1168     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1169     *  will be translated based on the
1170     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}
1171     *  â whatever that is.</p>
1172     *
1173     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1174     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1175     *      is {@code null}.
1176     *  @return The object's string representation.
1177     *
1178     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1179     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1180     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1181     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1182     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1183     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1184     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1185     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1186     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1187     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1188     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1189     */
1190    @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks", "OverlyComplexMethod"} )
1191    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1192    public static final String toString( final Object object, final String nullDefault )
1193    {
1194        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1195        if( nonNull( object ) )
1196        {
1197            final var objectClass = object.getClass();
1198            if( objectClass.isArray() )
1199            {
1200                if( objectClass == byte [].class )
1201                {
1202                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (byte []) object );
1203                }
1204                else if( objectClass == short [].class )
1205                {
1206                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (short []) object );
1207                }
1208                else if( objectClass == int [].class )
1209                {
1210                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (int []) object );
1211                }
1212                else if( objectClass == long [].class )
1213                {
1214                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (long []) object );
1215                }
1216                else if( objectClass == char [].class )
1217                {
1218                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (char []) object );
1219                }
1220                else if( objectClass == float [].class )
1221                {
1222                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (float []) object );
1223                }
1224                else if( objectClass == double [].class )
1225                {
1226                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (double []) object );
1227                }
1228                else if( objectClass == boolean [].class )
1229                {
1230                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (boolean []) object );
1231                }
1232                else
1233                {
1234                    retValue = deepToString( (Object []) object );
1235                }
1236            }
1237            else
1238            {
1239                retValue = object.toString();
1240            }
1241        }
1242
1243        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1244        return retValue;
1245    }   //  toString()
1246
1247    /**
1248     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument into a
1249     *  {@link String}
1250     *  using the given instance of
1251     *  {@link Stringer}.}
1252     *  If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1253     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1254     *  instead.</p>
1255     *
1256     *  @param  <T> The type of the object.
1257     *  @param  value   The object; may be {@code null}.
1258     *  @param  stringer    The method that is used to convert the given object
1259     *      to a String.
1260     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1261     *      is {@code null}.
1262     *  @return The object's string representation.
1263     *
1264     *  @see    Stringer
1265     */
1266    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1267    public static final <T> String toString( final T value, final Stringer<? super T> stringer, final String nullDefault )
1268    {
1269        requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1270
1271        final var retValue = nonNull( value ) ? requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( value ) : nullDefault;
1272
1273        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1274        return retValue;
1275    }   //  toString()
1276}
1277//  class Objects
